Perhaps you could use some training?' else tell %actor.name% Greetings adventurer.  Improving your skills taking too long?  I can help you for a fee. endif

triggers.name: load random gems
triggers.commands: if %self.aff_flagged[INVIS]% vis endif * number of gems to load -- starting at 3, but that might be too many set loop 3 * gem vnums go from  to 55566-55751 * p1 vnums from 55566-55593 * p2 vnums from 55594-55670 * P3 cnums from 55671-55747 (there are gems up to 55751, but not used. * random # -- 1-10 to create probabilities of good gem * 0 = NO GEM * 1 = NO GEM * 2-6 = P1 Gem * 7-9 = P2 Gem * 10  = P3 Gem * -- lets see if we should run process to get gems * -- we do that by looking for object 18701 -- if we are wearing it * -- then we don't need to load gems again * all the important stuff encased in this loop if !%self.wearing[18701]% mload obj 18701 mat 1100 wear lock set itt 1 while %itt% <= %loop% set p %random.10% if %p% == 10 *say p3! %p% set base 55671 set extra %random.76% endif *p2 gem if (%p% <=9) && (%p%>=7) *say p2 %p%555 set base 55594 set extra %random.76% endif *p1 gem if (%p% <=6) && (%p%>=2) *say p1 %p% set base 55566 set extra %random.27% endif *no gem if (%p% < 2) *say no gem - %p% set base 0 set extra 0 endif if %base% > 55560 eval gem %base% + %extra% mload obj %gem% sell gem elspeth endif eval itt %itt% + 1 done chuckle say you wouldn't believe who I had to beat down to get these flex endif * * Adding hint to find Rogue Guild for Elspeth * if %self.vnum% == 3010 if %actor.class% == Rogue && %actor.level% < 10 wait 4 msend %actor% %self.name% notices you skulking about her shop. msend %actor% &7&b%self.name% tells you, 'If you're looking for a certain Guild Hall, &6search&7 behind&0 msend %actor% &0&7&bthe &6curtain&7 on the wall.'&0 endif endif

triggers.name: corpse retrieval greet
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 4 mecho %self.name% says, 'Welcome to the headquarters of the Bloody Red Cross.  We provide mecho &0corpse retrieval services for unlucky adventurers.' wait 1s say Are you in need of a corpse retrieval? endif

triggers.name: corpse retrieval price set
triggers.commands: if %actor.vnum% == -1 wait 2 set cha %actor.real_cha% *make sure they have a quest record for saving variables if %actor.quest_stage[corpse_retrieval]% < 1 quest start corpse_retrieval %actor.name% endif say We can certainly help you with that... wait 1s say For a price. wait 1s mecho %self.name% says, 'But understand, if you don't have a corpse out there, this spell mecho &0will fail and you won't get your money back.' wait 2s eye %actor% * This portion is for smooth speech indicating the effects of a player's cha and level. if %actor.level% < 10 say You're still a fresh-faced adventurer... mecho if %cha% > 80 mecho %self.name% says, '... and you're a sweet kid. mecho &0I'll give you a good rate.' elseif %cha% < 50 say ... but your face is just so punchable. mecho &0So, this is really gonna cost ya.' else say ... and we all need a little help from time to time. endif elseif %actor.level% < 30 say Be careful, things are tougher out there for you now... mecho if %cha% > 80 mecho %self.name% says, '... but you are pretty charming. mecho &0I'll give you a good rate.' elseif %cha% < 50 mecho %self.name% says, '... and you probably had it coming. mecho &0So, this is really gonna cost ya.' else say ... but we all get into tight scrapes now and then. endif elseif %actor.level% < 50 say You've seen your fair share of action... if %cha% > 80 mecho %self.name% says, '... but you're still pretty likable. mecho &0I'll give you a good rate.' elseif %cha% < 50 mecho %self.name% says, '... and you probably asked for most of it. mecho &0So, this is really gonna cost ya.' else say ... so take more precautions. endif elseif %actor.level% < 70 say You really should know how to survive better by now... mecho if %cha% > 80 mecho %self.name% says, '... but you're pretty likable. mecho &0I'll give you a good rate.' elseif %cha% < 50 mecho %self.name% says, '... and it must be hard when people dislike you so much. mecho &0So, this is really gonna cost ya.' else say ... so try harder in the future. endif elseif %actor.level% < 90 say Seasoned heroes like you are hard to help... mecho if %cha% > 80 mecho %self.name% says, '... but you're very friendly. mecho &0I'll give you a good rate.' elseif %cha% < 50 mecho %self.name% says, '... and plenty of people hate you. mecho &0So, this is really gonna cost ya.' else say ... so don't rely on me too much. endif else say Helping a legend like you is extremely difficult... mecho if %cha% > 80 mecho %self.name% says, '... but you have a way with people.' mecho &0I'll give you a good rate.' elseif %cha% < 50 mecho %self.name% says, '... and every creature in the world wants you dead. mecho &0So, this is really gonna cost ya.' else say ... so you won't get much sympathy from me. endif endif mecho *Now a price is calculated eval price (%actor.level% * %actor.level% * ((%actor.level% * 2) / 3) * (100 - (%cha% / 10))) / 100 *now the price in copper has to be divided into coinage. eval plat %price% / 1000 eval gold %price% / 100 - %plat% * 10 eval silv %price% / 10 - %plat% * 100 - %gold% * 10 eval copp %price%  - %plat% * 1000 - %gold% * 100 - %silv% * 10 *now the price can be reported say My fee is %speech% for %plat% platinum, %gold% gold, %silv% silver, %copp% copper. mecho say Just get me the money and I'll cast the appropriate spells. quest variable corpse_retrieval %actor.name% price %price% quest variable corpse_retrieval %actor.name% actor_level %actor.level% endif

triggers.name: corpse retrieval payment
triggers.commands: if %actor.quest_variable[corpse_retrieval:actor_level]% == %actor.level% if %value% >= %actor.quest_variable[corpse_retrieval:price]% mforce %actor% consent %self% wait 1s nod %actor.name% wait 1s say That looks right.  Let's get started... wait 1s cast 'shift corpse' %actor.name% mecho %self.name% looks exhausted after casting. quest erase corpse_retrieval %actor.name% mforce %actor% consent off else mecho %self.name% says, 'Thank you for your donation to the Bloody Red Cross, but I'm mecho &0afraid that's all it was.' snicker %actor% mecho say I don't accept installments.  It's got to be all up front. endif else return 0 wait 1s consider %actor% wait 2s ponder wait 2s mecho %self.name% says, 'Something is different about you.  We have to adjust the spell mecho &0for your new strength.  Do you still want a corpse retrieval?' quest erase corpse_retrieval %actor.name% endif

triggers.name: corpse retrieval load
triggers.commands: mskillset %self% shift corpse

triggers.name: Make_Fountain_heal
triggers.commands: if (%arg% == pool || %arg% == granite) oheal %actor% 400 return 0 endif

triggers.name: Black_Rose_Wear_Tear
triggers.commands: **Trigger is meant as a tear drop in memory of Pergus** osend %actor% A small tear drops from the corner of your eye as you garnish the rose. oechoaround %actor% %actor.name% sheds a tear as %actor.n% adjusts the rose.

triggers.name: Black_Rose_Spawn_Pluck
triggers.commands: wsend %actor% You bend over and carefully pluck the &9&bblack&0 rose from between the two hearts. **some command to directly load 3298 to player inventory** wechoaround %actor% %actor.name% bends over and carefully plucks the &9&bblack&0 rose from between the two hearts. wait 1 wecho Another identical &9&bblack&0 rose magically grows up in the same spot.

triggers.name: newbie trainer Rousel
triggers.commands: wait 5 sa If you would like to attend Newbie training, just say newbie. sa but this isn't quite ready yet, so come back later.

rooms.name: The Forest Temple of Mielikki
rooms.description: You are standing in the ancient wooded grove that has served as a druidic temple for untold centuries.  Natural living sculptures decorate the area, living tribute to Mielikki's love of nature.  Above you, the ancient trees form a natural green canopy.  This area radiates peaceful serenity and you know that you are perfectly safe here.  The temple altar is to the north.  The entrance to the Cleric Guilds lies to the west of here.  To the south, you can see the Town Center.  Below is the entrance to the Ethilien Training Academy.  &_ &3&bIf you wish to receive new player training, type down and press enter.&0

North.description: You see the altar of the Goddess Mielikki to the north.

South.description: The hustle and bustle of the Town Center lies to the south.

West.description: You see the entrance to the Cleric and Druid guilds to the west.

extras.text: These trees have stood here, praising Mielikki for untold centuries.  Their mighty branches form a natural green canopy above the temple, reducing the effects of Mother Nature here, but not entirely eliminating them.

rooms.name: The Altar to Mielikki
rooms.description: You stand before the altar of the nature goddess, Mielikki.  This is the place where Ariana Shelti, the high priestess of Mielikki, conducts the services of the nature goddess.  The main temple lies to the south.

rooms.name: The Cleric's Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: You stand in one of this world's most holy places, the Inner Sanctum of the High Priestess to Mielikki.  The entire room is abundantly decorated with carvings of nature.  There is a large library in the northern part of the room, providing a good place to study.  The only exit is to the south.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Cleric Guilds
rooms.description: This is the entrance to the Inner Sanctum's of Mielikki's Cleric, Druid, and Priest Guilds.  There is a large carpet laid out that gives a feeling of nobility to the room.  The Forest Temple lies to the east.  Light streams downward upon a circular staircase leading upward here.

rooms.name: Town Center
rooms.description: The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The temple is directly north of this spot.  The fountain is to the south.  The Town Center itself continues on to the east and west.

rooms.name: Town Center
rooms.description: Marble paving stones lie carefully interlocked beneath the shady branches of several well-tended trees.  The plaza continues east and south, and the sound of running water comes from the southeast.  To the north is a medium-sized wooden building, tidy and well-kept.  A sturdy building to the west has a sign proclaiming "Office of the Templar".

extras.text: This is a low wooden building.  Its age is indeterminate.  It appears to be made of a local soft wood, which is stained from many seasons of weathering.
The marble is of a medium gray variety.  Its shade varies from stone to stone, but is always attractive.  It bears little resemblance to any local rocks.

The trees are tall and slender.  Their light gray bark is unmarred, and their gently spreading branches provide shade for the entire plaza.  Each tree is surrounded by a knee-high wall of stone, in which a small garden of simple flowers grows.

rooms.name: Town Center
rooms.description: The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The Town Center continues on the the west and south.  Just north of here, you can see a well-tended cobblestone path, and to the east is Jorhan's stables.

rooms.name: Town Center
rooms.description: The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The fountain is east of here.  The Town Center continues on the north and south.

rooms.name: Town Center Fountain
rooms.description: The hustle and bustle of the village is nowhere as evident as here, the center of this plaza. The grass grows green and thick around it, with paths leading to its center, where a fountain bubbles. Some people sit and picnic, while others just mill around.

rooms.name: Town Center
rooms.description: The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The fountain is to the west.  The Town Center continues on to the north and south.

rooms.name: Town Center
rooms.description: The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The western part of Main Street begins to the west.  The Town Center continues on to the north and east.

rooms.name: Town Center
rooms.description: The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The fountain is to the north.  The Town Center continues on to the east and west.

rooms.name: Town Center
rooms.description: The hustle and bustle of this living vibrant city is obvious here, on this marble-paved plaza.  Still, even here, the town's obvious closeness to nature is evident.  There are numerous well-tended trees here and the fountain at the center of the plaza is located in a large comfortable looking grassy area. Looks like a good place for a picnic.  The Dark Alley begins to the south. The eastern part of Main Street begins to the east.  The Town Center continues on to the north and west.

rooms.name: East Main Street
rooms.description: You are standing on the main east/west running street here.  To the north is Santiago's Weapon Shop and the Warrior's Guild.  To the west, Main Street passes through the Town Center.  The eastern part of Main Street continues on to the east.

rooms.name: East Main Street
rooms.description: You are standing on the main east/west running street here.  The eastern part of Main Street passes through Commerce Square to the east as well as going on to the west.

rooms.name: Commerce Square
rooms.description: This is the intersection of Main Street and Commerce Avenue.  You can leave the Square on Main Street by walking east or west.  You can also leave the Square on Commerce Avenue by walking north or south.

rooms.name: East Main Street
rooms.description: You are standing on the main east/west running street here.  The eastern part of Main Street passes through Commerce Square to the west and ends near the town's east gate just east of here.

rooms.name: Inside the East Gate
rooms.description: You are now standing on the easternmost outskirts of the town, looking through a short tunnel to the town gates.  Who can say what exactly lies beyond the safe confines of the town, but it must surely be exciting!  Main Street begins just to the west of here.

rooms.name: Outside the East Gate
rooms.description: You are standing just outside the town's eastern gates.  A path begins here and continues on to the west.  You can see some fields and light forest just to the east of town from here.

rooms.name: Santiago's Weapon Shop
rooms.description: Santiago's Weapon Shop is decorated from floor to ceiling with paintings and other memorabilia of the most famous battles of the past century, all of which Santiago himself has fought in, usually on the winning side.  The shop looks like it is well stocked.  The main exit to the south will return you to East Main Street.  An exit to the east will take you to the entrance of the Warrior's Guild.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Warrior's Guild
rooms.description: This is the entrance to the Inner Sanctum of the Warrior's Guild.  It is spartanly decorated with displays of curious ancient weapons as well as a few tapestries depicting epic battles.  The Inner Sanctum lies to the north. Santiago's Weapons Shop is to the west.

rooms.name: The Warrior's Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: You stand in one of this world's finest arenas, the Inner Sanctum of the greatest War Coach to ever lead Mielikki's armies in the town's defense.  The entire room is almost entirely unadorned, except for a few pieces of the Coach's personal memorabilia.  It is indeed a privilege to be here.  The only exit is to the south.

rooms.name: North Commerce Avenue
rooms.description: You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  To the east is Lisa's House of Leather.  Just south of here lies Commerce Square.  The northern part of Commerce Avenue continues on to the north from here.

rooms.name: North Commerce Avenue
rooms.description: You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  Aaron's General Store is to the east.  The northern part of Commerce Avenue continues on to the north and south from here.

rooms.name: Aaron's General Store
rooms.description: You are now standing in Aaron's General Store.  This seems to be a very roomy building with lots of storage capacity, although it isn't being fully utilized at this time.  Aaron must have plans for expansion.

rooms.name: North Commerce Avenue
rooms.description: You are standing at the north end of a major north/south street.  Helena's Bakery is to the west and you can smell the sweet smell of Helena's famous secret-recipe donuts from here.  The northern part of Commerce Avenue continues on to the south from here.

rooms.name: Helena's Bakery
rooms.description: You are now standing in Helena's world famous bakery.  It is clean and well-tended to, obviously big factors in her success, but the biggest factor was what you smelled from the street outside, Helena's world famous donuts! Of course, where there are donuts...

rooms.name: South Commerce Avenue
rooms.description: You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  The southern part of Commerce Avenue continues on to the north and south.  A colorful-looking toy store, Freddy's Toys for Girls and Boys, is just to the east.

rooms.name: South Commerce Avenue
rooms.description: You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  To the east is Kayla's Pet Shop.  The southern part of Commerce Avenue ends to the south at New Castle Square and continues on to the north.

rooms.name: Kayla's Pet Shop
rooms.description: The noises of various pets all clamouring simutaneously echo throughout this structure.  Still, if you love animals, this must be close to heaven!  South Commerce Street is to the west.

rooms.name: The Backroom of Kayla's Pet Shop
rooms.description: Kayla's backroom, YOU SHOULD NOT BE HERE, tell a god.

rooms.name: Dark Alley
rooms.description: You are standing in a dark and smelly alleyway running east/west from here. The Dark Alley ends to the west just south of the Town Center and to the east just north of the City Dump.  A pub with the sign of a drunken squirrel is directly south of here.

rooms.name: The Sloshed Squirrel
rooms.description: Marginally clean and organized, the interior of the pub is constructed mainly of wooden beams.  Just above the door, a large sign depicts a swaggering rodent holding a mug.  Tables are scattered about the room and a long bar runs along the south wall.

rooms.name: Dark Alley
rooms.description: You are standing at the eastern end of a dark and smelly alleyway. Tr'ven's workshop is to the North, The City Dump is to the south and the Dark Alley continues on to the west.

rooms.name: The City Dump
rooms.description: This is the place where all GOOD citizens drop off the useless junk they no longer wish to lug around with them or pay to store elsewhere.  If YOU have useless junk you want to get rid of, this is the place to drop it!  Mountains of junk loom to the east in some kind of massive junkyard expansion of the city dump.

rooms.name: A Fine Jewelry Shop
rooms.description: This lovely little shop is spacious and elegant, with light-colored painted walls and a thick carpet on the floor.  A pretty glass lantern hangs from the ceiling, providing light.  Somebody clearly put a lot of thought into the decorations, for they provide an exquisite background for the three counters arranged tastefully around the shop.  Each counter holds inside its glass walls a small selection of jewelry.

East.description: A fancy curtain hangs on the wall.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Rogue's Guild
rooms.description: This is the entrance to the Inner Sanctum of the Rogue's Guild.  There is one weak light coming from a small candle in the corner of the room.  The darkness combined with the shadows that never seem to stay still give this room an eerie feel.  The Inner Sanctum is down.  The Jewelry Shop lies to the west.

rooms.name: The Rogue's Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: You are in one of this world's most insidious places, the Inner Sanctum of the Rogue's Guild.  There are various tools for the teaching of deceit and other conniving skills.  This training area is very dirty, and has not been kept up very well.  It provides the perfect setting to perform many acts, without being seen.

rooms.name: West Main Street
rooms.description: You are standing on the main east/west running street here.  To the south is Bigby's Magic Shop and the Mage's Guild.  To the east, Main Street passes through the Town Center.  The western part of Main Street continues on to the west.

rooms.name: West Main Street
rooms.description: You are standing on the main east/west running street here.  To the north, you can see the start of Sleepy Boulevard and the town's Inn.  To the west, Main Street ends at Smelter's Square.  The western part of Main Street also continues on to the east.

rooms.name: Smelter's Square
rooms.description: This is where Main Street and Smelter's Row mutually terminate.  You can leave the Square on Main Street by walking east.  You can also leave the square on Smelter's Row by walking south.  Immediately west of here lies the western gates of the town.

rooms.name: Inside the West Gate
rooms.description: You are now standing on the western most outskirts of the town, looking through a short tunnel to the town gates.  Who can say what exactly lies beyond the safe confines of the town, but it must surely be exciting!  Smelter's Square lies just to the east of here.

rooms.name: Outside the West Gate
rooms.description: You are standing just outside the town's western gates.  Farmer's Row begins here and continues on to the west.  You can see farmlands and thick forests just to the west of town from here.  The sounds of many insects emanate from the nearby farmlands.

rooms.name: Bigby's Magic Shop
rooms.description: This is the Magic Shop of the once-mighty wizard, Bigby.  Apparently he has decided to try to live the quiet life.  Perhaps this is all part of a plan that only another Mage could understand.  In any event, the Magic Shop seems to be well stocked with magical devices.  You can return to Main Street via the exit to the north.  To the south is the entrance to the Mage's Guild.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Mage's Guild
rooms.description: The magic being emitted through this room gives your body an uncomfortable chill.  There is a strong heat coming from above, and a cold breeze flowing from below.  The Inner Sanctum of the Mage's Guild lies to the east, and Bigby's Magic Shop is to the north.

rooms.name: The Mage's Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: You stand in an extremely magical place that may or may NOT be a part of this world, the Inner Sanctum of the Mage's Guild.  The entire room seems to only be loosely tied to this realm of existence, magic floats freely through the air.  With a little help, perhaps you can absorb some of it.  It is indeed a privilege to be here.  The only exit is to the west.

rooms.name: Sleepy Boulevard
rooms.description: You are standing on a major north/south running street.  To the south lies Main Street.  The Forest Inn is directly west of here and the Post Office is directly east of here.  Sleepy Boulevard continues on to the north.

rooms.name: Sleepy Boulevard
rooms.description: You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  Sleepy Boulevard continues on to the north and south from here.

rooms.name: Sleepy Boulevard
rooms.description: You are standing on a major north/south running street here.  To the north, Sleepy Boulevard ends inside the North Gate of the town.  Sleepy Boulevard continues on to the south from here.

rooms.name: Inside the North Gate
rooms.description: You are now standing on the northernmost outskirts of the town, looking through a short tunnel to the town gates.  Who can say what exactly lies beyond the safe confines of the town, but it must surely be exciting!  Sleepy Boulevard begins just south of here.

rooms.name: Outside the North Gate
rooms.description: You are standing just outside the town's northern gates.  To the north, you can see where The Great Road starts, leading north to Anduin.  All around The Great Road are swamplands, stretching as far as your eyes can see.

rooms.name: The Forest Inn
rooms.description: This is the entrance to the famed Forest Inn.  You have heard a lot about it for two reasons.  The Forest Inn is well-known for its comfortable rooms and friendly staff.  Also, it happens to be the only Inn around.

rooms.name: The Forest Tavern
rooms.description: You are in the drinking extension of the Forest Inn.  Patrons and townfolk alike mix here freely over a brew at all hours of the day and night.  You are more than welcome to pull up a chair and join in as long as you can pay the rather hefty bar tabs.

rooms.name: The Forest Inn Reception Area
rooms.description: This is the reception area, where customers check in and out of the Forest Inn.  Behind the counter, you can see many secure cubbyholes to store your equipment in and many, many rooms containing beds that look comfortable beyond belief.  Are you tired yet?

rooms.name: Smelter's Row
rooms.description: You are standing on a minor north/south running street here.  To the east is Granite's Shield Emporium and to the west is Drako's Bronze Shop.  To the north lies Smelter's Square, where Smelter's Row and Main Street both terminate. Smelter's row continues on to the south.

rooms.name: Smelter's Row
rooms.description: You are standing on a minor north/south running street here.  To the east is Beowyn's Armoury and to the west is Shauna's House of Iron.  Just south of here lies New Castle Plaza, where both Smelter's Row and New Castle Road terminate. Smelter's Row continues on to the north.

rooms.name: Beowyn's Armoury of Steel
rooms.description: You are standing in Beowyn's Armoury.  Steel plates, ranging in size from mere inches to several meters across seem to be everywhere in this shop. Beowyn is obviously well prepared to handle any sudden surges in the demand for steel armours.  The atmosphere of this place makes you comfortable in spending your hard earned gold on Beowyn's armour -- anything made in a place like this could probably withstand anything short of dragon's breath!  The only exit from this place is to the west, back on to Smelter's Row.

rooms.name: New Castle Plaza
rooms.description: You are standing in New Castle Plaza, the place where Smelter's Row and New Castle Road join.  Smelter's Row continues on to the north and New Castle Road continues on to the east.

rooms.name: New Castle Road
rooms.description: You are standing on a major east/west running street here.  To the west, New Castle Road and Smelter's Row terminate at New Castle Plaza.  To the south, you see the splendor of the Royal Plaza.  New Castle Road continues on to the east.

rooms.name: New Castle Road
rooms.description: You are standing on a major east/west running street here.  New Castle Road continues on to the east and west from here.

rooms.name: New Castle Road
rooms.description: You are standing on a major east/west running street here.  New Castle Road continues on to the east and west from here.

rooms.name: New Castle Road
rooms.description: You are standing on a major east/west running street here.  New Castle Road continues on to the east and west from here.  To the north is Mielikki Bank.

South.description: Before you stand the grand doors to City Hall of Mielikki.

rooms.name: New Castle Road
rooms.description: The road passes through a particularly dull section of the village here. Simple fences line both sides of the road.  There seem to be small dwellings, inaccessible from here, to the north.  To the south is a medium-sized building which also presents no obvious entrance.

rooms.name: New Castle Road
rooms.description: This is a major east-west street in the heart of the village.  A nondescript fence lies to the south, while a wide building with a low roof squats to the north.  The sounds of conversation and dishes and a faint smell of fried food come from the building.

rooms.name: New Castle Road
rooms.description: This east/west road terminates to the east in a small square.  It forms a T-intersection here with a minor street leading south.  To the north, a high wooden fence festooned with aromatic mistletoe stands.  Light whiffs of an unpleasant smell manage to pass through the fence from time to time.

rooms.name: New Castle Square
rooms.description: You are standing in New Castle Square, where Commerce Avenue and New Castle Road both terminate.  Commerce Avenue continues on to the north and New Castle Road continues on to the west.

rooms.name: Windy Way
rooms.description: You are standing on a minor north/south running street here.  To the north, you can see New Castle Road.  Windy Way begins here and continues to the south.

rooms.name: Windy Way
rooms.description: You are standing on a minor north/south running street here.  Just east of here lies an old abandoned house.  Windy Way continues on to the north and south from here.

rooms.name: Windy Way
rooms.description: You are standing on a minor north/south running street here.  To the south, Windy Way ends at the town's South Gate.  Windy Way continues on to the north.

rooms.name: Inside the South Gate
rooms.description: You are now standing on the southernmost outskirts of the town, looking through a short tunnel to the town gates.  Who can say what exactly lies beyond the safe confines of the town, but it must surely be exciting!  Windy Way begins just to the north of here.

rooms.name: Outside the South Gate
rooms.description: You are standing just outside the town's southern gates.  A trail starts here and continues on to the south.  You can see a strange blue fog that seems to cling to the land to the south.  It looks somehow unnatural.  There is a large sign attached to a rusty post here.  It looks important!

extras.text: The word rusty might be too kind. You wonder why it hasn't crumbled into a pile of dust. Its definately very old.

* * * * * WARNING! * * * * * You are about to leave the protected Village of Mielikki! The Guardians of Mielikki cannot protect you if you choose to travel the BlueFog Trail. All recent reports indicate that the trail is overrun by extremely dangerous monsters and that the Seaport of Specula has sealed itself off. Travel is at your own risk!

rooms.name: Royal Plaza
rooms.description: You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the east and south.

rooms.name: Royal Plaza
rooms.description: You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  To the north is New Castle Road.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the west, east, and south, with a magnificent marble fountain to the south.

rooms.name: Royal Plaza
rooms.description: You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the west and south.

rooms.name: Royal Plaza
rooms.description: You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the north, south, and east, with a magnificent marble fountain to the east.

rooms.name: Royal Plaza Fountain
rooms.description: You are standing in the center of the richly appointed Royal Plaza next to the Royal Fountain.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble with a fountain built in to the middle of it, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on in every direction.

rooms.name: Royal Plaza
rooms.description: You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the north, south, and west, with a huge marble fountain directly west of here.

rooms.name: Royal Plaza
rooms.description: You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the north and east of here.

rooms.name: Royal Plaza
rooms.description: You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Castle Entrance is directly south of here.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the east, west, and north, with a huge marble fountain directly north of here.

rooms.name: Royal Plaza
rooms.description: You are standing in the richly appointed Royal Plaza.  Carved from a single huge slab of marble, the Royal Plaza seems to cover an enormous area with not so much as a single flaw in its marble surface.  Regal indeed.  The Royal Plaza continues on to the north and west of here.

rooms.name: Castle Entrance
rooms.description: This is the entrance to the fabulous Grey Castle!  It would appear that the Grey Knight and his Guardians are once again accepting visitors.  A person of virtue would certainly be welcome here.

rooms.name: Pet Shop Back Room
rooms.description: This is where they store the pets...  You should NOT be here!

rooms.name: Drako's Bronze Shop
rooms.description: You are now standing in Drako's Bronze Shop.  The shop is not very well maintained, although it is far from slovenly.  Its obvious that Drako is very interested in keeping his overhead low, competing as he is with so many other armourers on Smelter's Row.  Still, the quality of Drako's work is apparent. You'll likely get your money's worth here.  The only exit from this place is east, back on to Smelter's Row.

rooms.name: Shauna's House of Iron
rooms.description: You are now standing in Shauna's House of Iron.  Its obvious that Shauna has little faith in the new Steel process, as evidenced by the complete lack of steel armours in her shop.  Not to mention the disparaging anti-steel slogans hanging on her walls.  Nonetheless, Shauna has mastered the olden iron-working methods and her armours are of the very highest quality available.  Well worth the cost.  The only exit from this place is east, back on to Smelter's Row.

rooms.name: Granite's Shield Emporium
rooms.description: You are standing in Granite's Shield Emporium, the home of Granite the Shield Master.  Shields of all types adorn the walls.  You can certainly find any shield worth having in the selection here.  The only exit from this place is west, back on to Smelter's Row.

rooms.name: Lisa's House of Leather
rooms.description: This large wooden building smells strongly of leather and furs. Stacks and piles of various leather goods, all around, are displayed, sometimes to advantage, sometimes not. Prices are marked carefully on each bin, stack, and rack. An open door leads west, to Commerce Avenue.

rooms.name: The Druid's Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: You stand in one of this world's most harmonious places, the Inner Sanctum of the High Druid to Mielikki.  The room seems almost alive and you feel closer to nature than you have ever been before.  The luscious plant-life here consists of the most beautiful flowers you have ever seen.  The only exit is to the east.

rooms.name: The Post Office
rooms.description: You are standing in the town's post office.  A place where you can leave private mail messages for other people who frequent the town.

rooms.name: The Mielikki Bank
rooms.description: This small building sees a lot of customers every day. Despite this, it is freshly swept and tidy. Orderly lines form up in front of a large marble counter at the northern end of the bank. The only exit stands to the south.

rooms.name: The Holding Cell
rooms.description: This cell is dark and a swampy moisture permiates the air.  Slime and moss dominate the walls of the cell and the bars of the cell door look ancient and nearly worn through.

rooms.name: Jorhan's Stables
rooms.description: Jorhan's Stables are nicely constructed, and hardly reek of horse.  The fencing keeping the tamed beasts caged off is made of sturdy, formerly polished oak.  Jorhan has a small counter set up to do business on one side, and across from that are some stacks of grain and other animal foods.  The exit is to the west.

rooms.name: The Backroom to Jorhan's Stables
rooms.description: Jorhan's backroom, YOU SHOULD NOT BE HERE, tell a god.

rooms.name: The Cryomancer's Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: As you enter your guildhall you are splashed with mysts that are seemingly falling out of the sky.  The pictures on the walls suggest that this room has been the home of water wizards for many years.  This room is much colder than any other room around these parts.  There is a light frost on the ground, which has been cast there for the sole purpose of experimentation.

rooms.name: The Pyromancer's Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: Your eyes light up as you enter your current guildhall.  There are fires buring on all sides creating a calm warmth throughout the room.  There are two main areas of study in this large inferno.  One located near a blazing chimney and the other, a more peaceful area, is located in the southern section.

rooms.name: The Priest's Inner Sanctum
rooms.description: As you enter this room, you are astonished by its size.  There is a huge library containing many old texts to the left of you, and a huge study area to the right.  This is one of the most peaceful rooms in this small town, and Zeno, your guildmaster, assures that you wil be guided in the right direction.

rooms.name: Bigby's Research Room
rooms.description: This small room, no larger than a closet, is filed with a large quantity of scrolls.  These scrolls cover almost every inch of the room including its one table which is also host to a small lantern.  A small spiral staircase winds upward, but the clutter in the room makes it impossible to get to from here. The magic shop lies down.

rooms.name: The Templar's Training Room
rooms.description: Many weapons of all kinds decorate a large portion of the walls of this bright spacious room.  An elaborate coat of arms hangs on the east wall, well-lit by several tall candles.  The exit is east.

East.description: The shaded, marble-tiled plaza of Mielikki's Town Center lies to the east.

rooms.name: The Headquarters of the Bloody Red Cross
rooms.description: This dank cellar has been converted into a strange medical laboratory of some kind.  Body parts in jars and bags fill rickety old wooden shelves.  A single large workbench, roughly the size of an adult human, sits in the middle of the room, surrounded by grotesque bladed implements.  The distinct stench of rotting flesh fills the air.  Yet there is fresh gore and viscera everywhere. Burners are burning and test tubes are bubbling away, casting odd shadows about the cold stony room.  It's clear this lab is in regular use.

rooms.name: Dark Alley
rooms.description: You are standing at the western end of a dark and smelly alleyway.  The Town Center is to the north and the Dark Alley continues on to the east.

rooms.name: Entrance to the Sewers
rooms.description: You are standing if front of what looks to be a town sewer.  The smells and noises that bellow from the inside only make it seem more dangerous.  Rumor has it that a terrible mutation lurks in the sewers here.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewers
rooms.description: Your first steps into the sewers here are climbing down and old rusty iron ladder that has somehow held together in the past few years.  Raw sewage trickles beneath your feet and a horrid odor reaches your nose.  The sewer pipes bend to the west and north.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewers
rooms.description: The concrete walls here are begin to decay and crumble to dust.  Something that looks like and air vent is in the ceiling here but it looks much too slippery to climb to.  The sewer pipes lead to the east and west.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewers
rooms.description: Something about this room seems not right, the room is in perfect order. The only thing that looks very strange here is two huge slime tracks in the middle of the room.  The sewer pipes lead to the east and west.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Murky Sewer
rooms.description: You can't see much here but the echo tells you that there's quite a sharp drop off.  You can just make out a huge dark pool of sewer water in the darkness, mostly because of the trickling of water.  The foul water from the sewer actually washes over this ledge and makes it quite treacherous.  The sewer pipes bend to the east and to the south.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewer
rooms.description: This room too is in perfect order, except in this room the slime tracks seem to be very fresh!  Loud waves can be heard as putrid smells attack your nose. The sewer pipes lead to the north and to the south.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Murky Sewer
rooms.description: You are standing in mud up to your ankles.  This is a bend in the sewer with sewer pipes bending to the north and east.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewer
rooms.description: This portion of the sewer has begun to fall into such a decay here that even the stone you walk on crumbles as you move your feet.  The sewer pipe continue to the east and west.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewer
rooms.description: The raw sewage flows right at your feet, the stench growing with every step you take.  The sewer pipes continue to the west and east.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewer
rooms.description: This is another wonderfully clean room.  The slimy trails in the middle of the room seem to be getting fresher the further into the sewers you go.  The sewers continue to the west and east.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewer
rooms.description: The mud in this portion of the sewers is almost waist deep.  There is an air vent in the top of the sewer system here, but no fresh air seems to come from there.  The sewers continue on to the west and east from here.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Murky Sewer
rooms.description: The sewer system seems to be backed up here.  Piles of leafs have been gathering in for a long time.  The sewer pipe bends the the north and west.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewer
rooms.description: This is the nastiest room down here in the sewers.  Everything here is covered in muck in here and is terribly horrid smelling.  Garbage here seems to flow to the west, but doesn't move further than a few inches.  The sewer pipes continue to the north and south.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewer
rooms.description: This appears to be where the clean sparkling water leads into the sewers. This room is spotless and even looks like the water could be drinkable.  The sewer pipes lead on to the north and south.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Murky Sewer
rooms.description: The sparkling water here appears to be getting a little more dingy looking. There are a few beer bottles and rations floating down the sewer.  The sewer pipes bend to the west and south.

rooms.name: The Murky Sewer
rooms.description: The sparkling water here has become gray and smelly.  Leaves and donuts litter the ground around the sewer pipe here.  The sewer pipes continue to the west and east.

rooms.name: A Bend in the Murky Sewer
rooms.description: Grey water slowly moves along its canal here.  The smell that floats from the water is that of dead fish and dung.  The sewer pipe bends to the south and east.

rooms.name: The Grand Sewer Pipe
rooms.description: You are in the beginning of the Grand Sewer Pipe.  The pipes along here are spotless and all appear to be in perfect working order.

rooms.name: The Grand Sewer Pipe
rooms.description: You are entering the heart of the sewers.  Growls and mumbling can be heard from furthers west.  The grand sewer pipe leads to the west to the east.

rooms.name: The Grand Sewer Pipe
rooms.description: Nearing the end of the sewers, the chants and mumblings get louder.  A very fresh slime trail is slowly taking over the floor.  The grand sewer pipe leads from the west to the east.

rooms.name: The End of the Grand Sewer Pipe
rooms.description: The grand sewer pipe comes to an end here.  In front of you is some crumbled concrete that has fallen from the wall.  Piles of maggot dung amount up in the corner.  This room reeks of feces.  Spider webs hang from the ceiling, looking at them you wonder how many spiders had to have once been here to make such elaborate designs.

rooms.name: The Junkyard
rooms.description: This expansion of the city dump is home to massive piles of scrap more voluminous than anyone could ever hope to dig through in several lifetimes. Much of the debris is old scrapped armor, too worn or rusted or burned to be of much use to anyone but a select few.  Mountains of refuse loom in all directions.  Finding anything here would be an impossible task for any but the most accomplished hoarders.  You can make your way to the main dump to the west.

rooms.name: Freddy's Toys for Girls and Boys
rooms.description: Bright colors adorn every corner and wall of this room, looking almost like a circus house.  Every manner of childhood dream can be seen on the shelves, from soft animal toys to carved wooden dolls to leathery footballs.

rooms.name: The Study Hall
rooms.description: The mages guild is a place of books, and discussion.  Fecil, however, the guilds trainer, Imagines something very different.  To the far end of the room, you see bookshelves and tables for research.  The majority of the room, though, consists of open floors and practice dumbies made of solid wood.  Here you can ask Fecil about a magic skill you'd like to receive training in, and he will tell you how much you will need to pay him.

rooms.name: The Guild Training Grounds
rooms.description: This room is lined with pillars with lit torches, casting shadows paternlessly around the room.  Nasty-looking weapons hang from the walls, glinting in the dim lighting.  Sacks stuffed with straw are cruedly tied to a few of the pillars, for practice landing the most devistating blows.  Julk is here, more than glad to accept your money in exchange for teaching you what it takes to be more effective at taking more money from others.

rooms.name: The Warriors Training Facility
rooms.description: This room is quite busy, with guards and advernturers alike practicing their defensive skills.  There are a variety of shields and large weapons leaning or hanging on racks for the paying student.  Calken, the trainer, is coaching the various students around the room, as he paces the length of the facility.  You can ask him about the skills being practiced here, and once you've paid, you can join in.

rooms.name: Tr'ven's work shop
rooms.description: From floor to roof the shop is spotless.  Tools and weapons shimmer as they rest around the room.  Near the center of the room there is a lone workbench, cleared of the last project.  You can see the Dark Alley just out the door to the south.

rooms.name: The Cartographer's Room
rooms.description: This cozy little room on the main floor of the inn belongs to a skilled cartographer.  It has been meticulously filled from top to bottom, side to side, on every wall with books and scrolls.  The room is small and full but organized.

rooms.name: The Grand Foyer of City Hall
rooms.description: Mielikki City Hall is a modest building of old stone and heavy timber. Although it is a newer building in Mielikki, it is decorated in classic High Elven style like the oldest buildings in the region.  It's also surprisingly elaborate for a town the size of Mielikki.  The walls, painted with intricately detailed trees like the forest surrounding the village, rise from the smooth-polished stone floor to a high ceiling covered in motifs of the sun and moon.  Two smaller offices stand on either side of the foyer.  To the west is the Mielikki Housing Registry.  To the east is the Mielikki Business Registry. You can make your way south to City Hall's central rotunda.

rooms.name: City Hall Rotunda
rooms.description: Here in the heart of the City Hall of Mielikki stands a large rotunda.  The large dome overhead is made of white and gray marble and is capped with a bronze crown made by local bronze smith Drako himself.  Large windows ring the rotunda, welcoming warm sunlight by day and gentle moonlight by night.  In the center of the rotunda grows a large oak tree in honor of the goddess Mielikki for whom the town is named and draws its divine protection.  Two large chambers extend off the rotunda.  West are the Mielikki town archives.  East is the City Hall assembly chamber.  A wide flight of stairs leads to the Mayor's office on the second level of the rotunda.

rooms.name: The Mielikki Archives
rooms.description: This large stone chamber is lined with cabinets and shelves, each packed to bursting.  The documents stored here date all the way back to the founding documents of the town of Mielikki, tracing its history from tiny druidic outpost to a small town with outsized global influence.  In typical small town fashion though, nothing is particularly well sorted.  Finding any single document could take days or weeks, if even at all.  But with enough time and effort, who knows what secrets one might uncover?  The City Hall rotunda stands to the east.

rooms.name: City Hall Assembly Chamber
rooms.description: This large chamber serves as the central meeting place for administrative activities in the town of Mielikki, whether it's trials by the Mielikki Court of Justice, or the Smelter's Row Merchants Association annual meeting.  Before the eastern wall is a long table with a number of chairs for whatever council or group might be calling the gathering.  Hanging behind the table is a large tapestry of a marvelous oak tree against a green background, the heraldic icon for the town.  Filling in from the western side are rows and rows of benches for concerned citizens to sit.  Between the seating area and the council table stands a podium where the public might address the convening body.  The City Hall rotunda stands to the west.

rooms.name: Mielikki Housing Registry
rooms.description: This small office is where new residential allotments are certified by the town.  It contains a number of clerk's desks, each supplied with ample amounts of ink and paper for the writing and ratifying of contracts.  All contracts are ultimately stored in the Archive and fees are taken to the Mielikki Bank multiple times a day, leaving very little of interest in this room.  At present, the register's office is closed.

rooms.name: Mielikki Business Registry
rooms.description: Those looking to secure permits to open up stores in the town of Mielikki do so here.  A few finely crafted work stations are set up around the office for prospective merchants to work through details with a town official.  Sets of unfinished documents housed in scroll cases and loosely bound volumes can be found across the office.  Tax schedules, architectural requirements, parcel specifications, and more are available as well.  Finalized agreements and permits are stored in the Archives.  At present, the register's office is closed.

rooms.name: The Mayor's Office
rooms.description: Perched on the second level of the rotunda and commanding a spectacular view of the court below, the Grey Castle to the west, and the Blue-Fog River to the south, the Mayor's office evokes a sense of grandeur greater than might otherwise be called for in this small forest town.  A cozy grated fireplace is nested into the south wall, a banner of green with an oak tree on it hanging above.  A sturdy dark mahogany desk with a plush padded chair stands off to one side.  A few ornate bookshelves line the opposite wall.  Various trophies and symbols of station, like a small bronze tree from the Druids of Mielikki which signifies their acknowledgement of the holder as Mayor, decorate the room. Yet each detail is more ostentatious than the last.  Why would someone running a town so austere invest so much in aesthetics?  And who's paying for all this?  Suspicious, to say the least!

rooms.name: Outside a Garden Entrance
rooms.description: Grey stones surround this narrow passageway, which only allows the most minute amounts of light in through its slender windows. A grand spiral staircase leads down, deep into the grey castle, while a large metal gate guards the entrance north into what may seem a lush and thriving garden.

North.description: A metal gate lays to the north

extras.text: Large black metal gates bar the entrance north into the garden. There appears to be something written on the main support of the grand gates, it reads: "Dedicated to the memory of our beloved friend and mentor Pergus, Rick Sala, this 9th Day of July, 2006."

rooms.name: The Peaceful Garden Entrance
rooms.description: The surrounding foliage provides a feeling more like a forest glade than a garden.  Even though none are visible, the soft sounds of a deer's scuffling hooves can be heard along with the sounds of salmon splashing upstream and ravens squawking their morning tune.  In the center is a clearing lit by shafts of sunlight, filtering down through the canopy of leaves above.  The shafts make a circle and outline a ring of finely crafted granite stones set into the ground.  In the center of the circle stands a large oak tree.  The garden gate lies to the south, while the garden continues to the west, north, and east.

South.description: A metal gate lays to the south.

extras.text: The Druid's life, as it be known, Is carved for all upon the stone To leave a lasting legacy For all who open eyes to see. So enter, breathe its air, Discover life's true meaning there, Written within the stars, so bright, Your path of everlasting light. Then set your foot upon this path And do not contemplate the math. The sky, unfurled before you now Will sanctify your sacred vow. The Druid's circle, once complete, Will lay its blessings at your feet And bring your spirit home, at last, To a garden of peace and love so vast.

The stones are all flat and smooth and look eerily alike as if each were an exact replica of the other.  Each stone is a circle itself, with a large enough diameter to stand within.  There is a small plaque near one of the stones.
A particularly familiar face stands out as it gently beams a smile.

To a friend, Pergus (Rick Sala), May your memory live on and grow like a giant oak. - Zantir 2006 Live thy Life, Young and old, Like yon oak, Bright in spring, Living gold; Summer-rich Then; and then Autumn-changed Soberer-hued Gold again. All his leaves Fall'n at length, Look, he stands, Trunk and bough Naked strength. Alfred, Lord Tennyson

The oak tree looks to have several delicately crafted faces all over the trunk that appear to change both location and expressions upon every glance. It appears as if this tree holds a spirit of some sort for year of age on the tree.  A small etching is inscribed at the base of the tree.

rooms.name: A Corner of a Peaceful Garden
rooms.description: The refreshing, bright green of sunlight through new leaves is the first noticeable sensation in this part of the garden.  Tiny, jewel-like flowers push themselves up out of a rich black soil imported from the farthest corners of the world.  A trellis made of living oak saplings grows here, branches intertwining and woven through with morning glory vines, gifting the garden with a constant, peaceful rustling of growing plants.  Soft chittering sounds are the only indication of the small animals that call this place home, aside from their tiny tracks in the soil.  A relaxing feeling sweeps around everything that enters here, giving peace to even the most stressed adventurers.  In the center of this section of the garden stands a grey stone altar carved with the symbol of a flame, and a tiny silver flame at the top of the altar is always lit despite the breeze.

extras.text: Young, vigorous oak saplings have set their roots into the black soil and have been coaxed by the druids to grow into a canopy above the garden, shielding it from harsh weather and giving those who walk under it a beautiful green light by which to see.  Reaching for the sun are flowers of a deep purple growing from vines: the short-lived but exquisitely beautiful morning glory, symbolizing transience.

The altar is about chest-high to a human and is made of stone quarried in the depths of the Wailing Mountains, famous for its durability.  The flame on the front is surely a dwarven creation, for no other race can make the stone seem to come alive.  Indeed it seems to be moving in concert with the actual flame set on top of the altar, which seems to have no source yet provides a constant light.  On the back of the altar is an inscription.
In memory of Pergus, Rick Sala. You will always be missed, my dear friend.  May others follow in your footsteps and your ideals never be forgotten. -Kourrya, 2006

These flowers are rich with the colors of gemstones, bringing to mind sapphires, amethysts, rubies, emeralds, and more.  Each has four soft petals and its own gentle yet sweet scent.  The soil they are planted in was imported from the volcanic Fiery Island, where the richest loam can be found.

rooms.name: A Corner of a Peaceful Garden
rooms.description: A large and expansive rose garden expanding to the edges of reality.  At the very center of the garden are two large white marble hearts encompasing a &9&bblack&0 rose in the center.

extras.text: A single &9&bblack&0 rose stands erect at the center of attention between the two hearts. This final farewell stands for all to see. Perhaps you should pluck it so you too will have something to remember him by.
The rose garden expands back in all directions filled with hundreds of roses. The color of the roses varries from white, yellow, orange, peach, blue and pink.
Two large white marble hearts at the center of the garden are surrounded by red roses. Each heart has a name engraved, the first reads Christa while the other reads Abby.

rooms.name: Within a Peaceful Garden
rooms.description: Calm and utterly quiet, this peaceful garden seems an ideal location for a moment's reprieve.  The only sounds that can be heard are those of the local wildlife as they scurry about in search of whatever it is wildlife does.  This area of the garden itself is surround with a large hedge that extends along the entire western edge of the area, blooming with multicolored buds that seem to attract the interest of the local insect population.  In the center of the area is an ancient willow tree that dominates the entire area with its presence and provides a comforting place for the weary to relax.  The willow tree itself hangs down from above and sways in the light breeze as small birds can be seen flying into and out-of its large branches.  Surrounding the large willow is a simple wooden fence which only stands approximately 3 feet above the ground, is almost completed engulfed in rows of ivy, and is outlined by rows of flowers of almost every shape and colour.

extras.text: The inscription written into this large willow reads: Rick Sala: June 1st, 1974 - June 21st, 2006 A dear friend, although your are gone you shall not be forgetten, for you memory and spirit lives on in all that we do and all that this represents.

This massive tree seems to be ancient as its large trunk is several meters around, at least. Its branches hang down protecting everything beneath it and hiding all the small animals that call this their home. An inscription is carved into the side of this tree.

rooms.name: The Center of a Peaceful Garden
rooms.description: Caught in a dream, an imaginary light, construed by the soul that entices the crystal clear sky.  A firm grasp of lush green vine nuzzles closely among its kinsman while combing the blue glow, haunting the air as fine myst lessens sight.  Violet tipped grass blankets firm ground in all stretches, a brush of beauteous sirens of the wisp nay the entrancing fear.  An aura of nobility and a humbling staff lie tarnished in the nesting of the statue. In both the unforeseen and the clear bequeaths harmony with confusion among the simple unseen briars hidden among the grassy knoll.  A lingering lace of unspoken heart-works are left in the sword that leads in pierced earth.  All are halted within spirit and flesh amidst the isle of the Druid.

rooms.name: Within a Peaceful Garden
rooms.description: Swaying slightly in an ethereal breeze, the beautiful white blossoms of well-groomed apricot trees dance silently in the air.  The magnificent white trees stand at each corner of this part of the garden, leaning in towards each other.  Draped between them, vines of white and green variegated ivy grow across the open air, creating a pleasant criss-crossed canopy above. Surrounding the base of each tree, brilliant growths of bush lily and cornflower have been cultivated up each trunk, the flowers forming elaborate patterns across the bark.  In the center of the garden, a diamond-shaped pearlescent pool collects water as it cascades down a tall, pyramidal fountain rising from the middle of the pool.  Seven matching black opal benches encircle the fountain, their smooth, polished surfaces glinting in the light.  A pitch-black cobblestone path lies between the benches and the fountain, its dark marble in stark contrast with the white blossoms of the trees above it. Spherical lanterns hover motionless at each corner of the pool, projecting a holy glow across their surroundings.  Their light illuminates the room as the sun, yet directly they appear muted and soft.  A peaceful tranquility permeates the atmosphere here, creating a sense of consecration and eternity.

extras.text: The pool's pearly exterior depicts detailed scenes and symbols in light, bas-relief etchings.  One scene records a commanding druid, arms outstretched among the nature around him, exuding a sense of natural harmony.  Another image shows a man engulfed in fire, molten streams of lava coursing on the ground around him.  Six monstrous rats are drawn before him, their sharply-fanged snouts facing outwards from his figure.  Continuing around the pool, the third image portrays the same man engulfed by fire standing above the curvature of the world, his right arm sweeping across its face creating forest and desert alike in its path.  The fourth and final etching illustrates another man, standing beside a woman and cradling a young girl in his arms.  They stand among a background of lightly etched roses.

Seven benches encircle the marble cobblestone footpath, placed at regular intervals.  Carved from the rarest of black opal, the benches are all identical, each polished surface etched with an elaborate capital D.  The sides of the benches are etched with elaborate Highlands patterns resembling clovers and spear-shaped leaves.

Around the base of each apricot tree, a wide circle of bush lilies and cornflowers grow intertwined, rising upwards where they meet the trunks.  The brilliant bittersweet-hued bush lilies and indigo cornflowers grow beautifully from glossy green-leaved stalks.  On each trunk, the stalks creep vine-like up the bark, flowers blooming continually along the creepers.  The lilies and cornflowers weave magnificient patterns across the dusky bark, almost seeming to form cognizant meaning but ultimately indistinguishable from natural growths.

Interlocking bricks of varied sizes, form a circular footpath surrounding the fountain.  The cobblestones are all pitch-black marble, light veins of poppy jasper running through at regular intervals.  Light glances off the polished surfaces of the stones, forever spellbound in a lustrous state.

Hovering spellbound above each corner of the pool, the spherical lanterns appear as simple globes of glowing light.  They emit no heat, and when looked at directly seem to be very soft and muted, yet their illumination brightens the room as daylight.  The spheres seem to be locked in their positions above the pool, just below the canopy above, and undoubtedly could not be moved by any natural means.

Shaped like a square, each corner of the pool points to a different cardinal direction.  The edge of the pearlescent pool rises several hand-widths from the ground, enclosing the water within.  The pool appears to be carved from a large single mass of pearl, undoubtedly supernatural in origin.  Elaborate bas-relief etchings cover the outer surface of the pool, depicting various scenes.  In the center of the pool, a pyramid of the same pearl rises out of the water, bubbling fresh, clear water from its tip.  Dancing rainbows of light flicker in the water cascading down the fountain's pearly surface.

The ivy vines grow out of the apricot tree trunks and into their boughs above, branching outward to hang across the open air between the trees. Dozens of vines lie above, forming an elaborate interlocking canopy of leaves. Each leaf is vaguely heart-shaped, with a green interior and a white border. Periodically along the vines, small green flower buds pop out from between the leaves.

The white petals of the apricot blossoms flutter soundlessly on dark-brown, nearly-black branches.  Each flower has a unique pattern of dotted white petals, pink and purple sepals, and soft yellow anthers.  They look extremely fragile, emphasized by the periodic cascades of petals in the air as the breeze fluctuates.  The apricot trees have no true leaves, locked in an immutable state of blossom.

rooms.name: Sitting Room
rooms.description: This looks to be a small, pleasant sitting room.  Bland, calming portraits hang from the whitewashed walls above padded chairs and a small sofa.  The seats are arranged around the center and eastern parts of the room, away from the south exit which is in the southeast corner.  There are no windows.

rooms.name: The Crane Fountain
rooms.description: A cool breeze carries the fresh scent of the garden.  A light mist can be felt in the air.  Passing through a bamboo gate, you come upon a field of green grass.  In the center of the field, five short stone pillars form a circle around a majestic granite pool.  Standing in the center of the pool, a brass crane elegantly spouts a stream of flowing water into the pool.  Torches burn atop each of the pillars.  There appears to be inscriptions at the base of each pillar.  The sound of children playing in the green grass can be heard all around.

extras.text: There is a name at the base of each pillar.  Daroowise, Nameless, Trystan, Brilan, and Pergus.

rooms.name: Home of the Illusionist
rooms.description: This is a large, pleasant room, beautifully inlaid with mahogany and papered with soothing designs.  There is no trace or sign of dirt, clutter, or imperfection anywhere.  Lilies sit in amber vases on small marble tables while sconces burn smokelessly on either side of the crackling fire.  It is dark, but not oppressively so; there is room and time to think.  An exit leads north.

rooms.name: Above a Peaceful Garden
rooms.description: The air above the peaceful garden below swirls and blows perpetually with a mix of gentle caress and ferocity assailing the flesh.  The air glitters and sparkles with a variety of color transitioning from red so bright it sears sight to black so deep the darkness sucks upon the body and soul alike to brilliant blues making the most valuable sapphire pale beside it to warm minglings of yellows, greens, and oranges.  Through the center of the air however beams a solitary never-dulling light pristinely focused upon the statue which stands below.  This column of light is impenetrable to any weapon, force, or attack and forever will shine upon, illuminate, and protect the druid below.

extras.text: For the strength and solidarity provided by our now absent friend and mentor. Peace upon your soul Rick, Pergus, Daroowise.  You shall be forever missed. -Tanle retired Implementor and Friend - July 2006

rooms.name: The Entrance to the Berserker Hall
rooms.description: You stand before a decrepit old building that does not seem to be of human or elven make unlike most of the other buildings in the area.  Its oddity being located just beyond the north gate in the swamp is compounded by the fact it seems to be missing a roof.  A set of smashed double doors stand in the old entryway.

rooms.name: Berserker Hall
rooms.description: Elevated enough to keep the swamp out, the hall is beaten and broken, hardly a weather-tight bastion of security.  That may not matter to the Berserker Guild who use this derelict old building as their Mielikki guildhall.  In fact, much of the damage seems to have been done from inside the hall.  Cracks and craters consistent with bashing by enormous clubs gouge the walls and floor. It seems a miracle this place is still standing at all.

rooms.name: The Newbie training cavern.
rooms.description: This room is decorated with weapons of every imaginable type, sadly they are behind unbreakable glass, or you would grab a few to test out.  The moldy smell leads you to believe you have gone down farther than 1 level, but you do feel safe here.

rooms.name: The Training Hall - The Basics
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: The Training Hall - Room 2
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: The Training Hall - Room 3
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: The Training Hall - Room 4
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: The Training Hall - Room 6
rooms.description: You are in an unfinished room.

rooms.name: Fingon's fun room.
rooms.description: This vast room is filled nearly to overflowing with every possible oddity.  Unidentified things jut out at all angles from shelves, boxes, and assorted containers.  All horizontal workspace is buried deep in a multitude of scrolls, tomes and technical journals.  You wonder just what kind of madman could call a place like this home?
